summary: A 2014 law requires federal agencies to have information security programs. We testified about how agencies have implemented their programs: While agencies have reported some progress, 17 of 23 civilian agencies did not fully meet their cybersecurity targets Inspectors General reported ineffective programs at 16 of 23 civilian agencies Our recent reports also identified major weaknesses in government-wide and agency-specific cybersecurity initiatives Agency officials have...
title: Cybersecurity: Preliminary Results Show That Agencies' Implementation of FISMA Requirements Was Inconsistent
